list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A blast of cold air entered the room when he opened the door.
Ed gave a blast on the car horn.

list_definition.definition: to tear (apart etc) by an explosion

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The door was blasted off its hinges by the force of the explosion.

list_definition.definition: (often with out) to come or be sent out, very loudly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Music (was being) blasted out from the radio.

list_ex_of_english: Many of these points are the expected consequences of having a massive planet blow up nearby, thereby blasting the facing hemisphere and leaving the shielded hemisphere relatively unscathed.
